column1: Neu-Hohenschönhausen  (New Hohenschönhausen) is a German locality (Ortsteil) in the borough (Bezirk) of Lichtenberg
column2: Berlin. Until 2001 it was part of the former Hohenschönhausen borough.

column3: hadn't a different name from Alt-Hohenschönhausen as part of it. The designation was used from the 1960s for this local part
column4: to distinguish it from the old town.

column1: Neu-Hohenschönhausen is located in the north-eastern part of Berlin. It borders with the localities of Malchow
column6: Stadtrandsiedlung Malchow (both in Pankow district) and Marzahn (in Marzahn-Hellersdorf district).

column1: The locality is divided into 4 zones (Ortsgebiete):
The locality is served by tram lines M4
column2: M5 and M17 of the Berlin tram network and by the S-Bahn stations of Hohenschönhausen (S75 line and Regionalbahn regional rail)
